result.execSummary:
The defendant Angelo Dilo Daniels was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Threat], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution of $504 to Jessica W.

AS TO ALL COUNTS: Pay mandatory costs, assessments, domestic abuse surcharges and surcharges.
Pay the supervision fees as determined by DOC.
No contact with firearms. Court advises the defendant he cannot possess firearms or ammunition.

No violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause. Do not use or possess alcohol or illegally controlled substances.
No contact with victim which rises to the level of probable cause for domestic abuse or harassment.

Random screening. Absolute sobriety.
Treatment or counseling programs as recommended. 
Complete Batterers Intervention program. 
Mental health evaluation. 
Take all prescribed medication.

timeConds.notes:
as to Count 2 - SERVE 90 DAYS at the House of Correction with work release for work, treatment or programs and medical appointments.
Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance, alcohol forfeits the release privileges.

Memorandum of Conditions of Probation received and filed./ds

Count 5:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 90 days at the House of Correction - straight time - consecutive to Counts 2 & 3.  COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of 24 months - concurrent.

CONDITIONS:  1) no violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay mandatory costs, assessments, domestic abuse surcharges and surcharges; 3) do not use or possess alcohol or illegally controlled substances; 4) random screening; 5) treatment or counseling programs as recommended; 6) maintain or obtain employmentemployment; 7) complete Batterers Intervention program ; 8) pay restitution of $504 to Jessica W.; 9) mental health evaluation; 10) take all prescribed meidcaiton; 11) absolute sobriety; 12) no contact with victim which rises to the level of probable cause for domestic abuse or harassment; 13) no contact with firearms; 14) pay the supervision fees as determined by DOC; 15) as to Count 2 - SERVE 90 DAYS at the House of Correction with work release for work, 
treatment or programs and medical appointments. 

Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance, alcohol forfeits the release privileges. 
 Court advises the defendant he cannot possess firearms or ammunition.

Appeal rights given.  

Court does not order a probation review hearing.  The agent can bring the case back into court if necessary to ask for condition time.

Defendant Angelo Dilo Daniels in court with attorney Jeffrey John Szczewski.  Defendant Angelo Dilo Daniels in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.   State advises the Court they have complied with victim notification.  Statements by counsel and defendant.  

Count 2:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 9 months at the House of Correction - straight time with 35 days credit.  COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of 24 months.

Count 3:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 9 months the House of Correction - straight time - consecutive to Count 2.  COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of 24 months - concurrent.

Defendant Angelo Dilo Daniels in court with attorney Jeffrey John Szczewski.  Defendant Angelo Dilo Daniels in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

Case was calendared for motion hearing and final pretrial this date.  Defense request to proceed with a plea hearing is granted by the court.

On motion of the state, pursuant to plea negotiations, Court ordered COUNTS 1 and 4 DISMISSED BUT READ IN

AS TO COUNTS 2, 3 and 5:
  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Plea questionnaire received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Defense request for a PR Bond is denied at this time.  Defendant is ordered REMANDED pending sentencing.

  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 44  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-04-2015 at 09:00 am.
State's Motion in Limine received an filed./ds
State's Witness List received and filed./ds
State's Requested Jury Instructions and Instructions received and filed./ds

Attorney Jeffrey John Szczewski in court, defendant Angelo Dilo Daniels not in court, in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams by telephone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

ADA Williams is ill and appears by telephone.  Court questions Attorney Szczewski if he has notified the Attorney General as to this motion.  Attorney had not notified the Attorney General.  Court adjourns motion.  Motion hearing scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
ADA Williams cannot appear on 4-27-15 for the motion.  Attorney agree to a new date of 4-29-15 at 1:30 p.m., Br. 44./ds
Motion to Dismiss Certain Counts received and filed.  Case set for motion on 4-27-15 at 1:30 p.m., Br. 44./ds

Defendant Angelo Dilo Daniels in court with attorney Jeffrey John Szczewski.  Defendant Angelo Dilo Daniels in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant enters a plea of not guilty to all counts.  Defendant makes a DEMAND FOR A SPEEDY TRIAL.  Pretrial scheduling order received and filed.   Any motions are to be filed by noon on 4-17-15.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defense motion to dismiss this criminal complaint based upon probable cause is reviewed and denied by the Court at this time.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Andrew Stockland-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading.  Case is adjourned to Branch 44.

Defendant Angelo Dilo Daniels in court with attorney Jeffrey John Szczewski.  Defendant Angelo Dilo Daniels in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
State files an AMENDED CRIMINAL COMPLAINT. Charges and penalities remain the same.  Correction to reflect the date of "September 26, 2014" as to COUNT 1 on page 1.  Arraignment scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, MOTION TO DISMISS FELONY AND OTHER COUNTS-PROBABLE CAUSE.

Defendant pleads Not Guilty as to all Misdemeanor Counts.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
